text:
Miguel Ángel Troitiño Vinuesa (1947 – 21 April 2020) was a Spanish geographer. He was a professor of human geography at the Complutense University of Madrid (UCM). He was an expert in cultural tourism and heritage preservation. He was born in El Arenal, Ávila, Spain.
He died of COVID-19 on 21 April 2020 in Madrid.
